news.title: Our Team Wins National Coding Competition
news.description: Congratulations to our students who secured first place in the National Collegiate Programming Contest, showcasing exceptional problem-solving skills and teamwork.
news.content:
In an outstanding display of computational prowess and collaborative excellence, our Computer Science team has emerged victorious at the National Collegiate Programming Contest (NCPC), marking a historic achievement for our institution.

The competition, held at the Federal University of São Paulo, brought together 150 teams from universities across Brazil. Our team, consisting of final-year students Ana Silva, Carlos Rodriguez, and Marina Santos, solved 8 out of 12 challenging algorithmic problems within the 5-hour time limit.

"This victory represents months of dedicated preparation and countless hours of practice," said team captain Ana Silva. "We focused intensively on dynamic programming, graph theory, and optimization algorithms."

The winning solution involved implementing a sophisticated algorithm for the maximum flow problem, which our team completed in just 45 minutes – faster than any other competing team.

Professor Dr. Miguel Costa, who coached the team, emphasized the importance of this achievement: "This demonstrates the quality of our computer science program and our students' exceptional analytical capabilities."

The team will now represent Brazil at the International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC) World Finals in April 2024, to be held in Kazakhstan.

This marks the third consecutive year our program has placed in the top 3 nationally, establishing our institution as a powerhouse in competitive programming education.
news.author: Prof. Ana Santos

news.title: Alumni Success Story: From Student to Tech Lead
news.description: Former student Maria Santos shares her journey from our program to becoming a Senior Software Engineer at Google.
news.content:
Maria Santos, who graduated from our Computer Science program in 2019, has recently been promoted to Senior Software Engineer at Google, where she leads a team developing machine learning infrastructure for Google Cloud Platform.

"My journey started right here in these classrooms," Maria reflects during our interview. "The solid foundation in algorithms, data structures, and software engineering principles I received here was crucial for my success."

After graduation, Maria began her career as a Junior Developer at a local tech startup, where she worked on web applications using React and Node.js. Her exceptional performance and leadership skills quickly caught the attention of larger companies.

In 2021, she joined Google as a Software Engineer II, working on the Google Cloud team. Within just two years, her contributions to improving the performance of machine learning workloads led to her promotion to Senior Software Engineer.

"One of the projects I'm most proud of is the optimization system I developed that reduced ML model training time by 40% for our enterprise customers," Maria explains.

Her advice to current students is clear: "Focus on fundamentals, but don't be afraid to explore new technologies. The programming languages and frameworks may change, but strong problem-solving skills and the ability to learn quickly will always be valuable."

Maria regularly returns to campus as a guest lecturer and maintains an active mentorship program for current students interested in machine learning and cloud computing.

Her success story serves as an inspiration to our current students and demonstrates the excellent career prospects available to graduates of our program.
news.author: Equipe de Comunicação

news.title: New Lab Equipment Arrives for Fall Semester
news.description: State-of-the-art workstations and development tools are now available to enhance our students' learning experience.
news.content:
The Computer Science Department is excited to announce the arrival of cutting-edge laboratory equipment that will significantly enhance our students' hands-on learning experience beginning this fall semester.

The new equipment includes 40 high-performance workstations, each featuring the latest Intel Core i9 processors, 32GB RAM, and NVIDIA RTX 4080 graphics cards. These powerful machines will support intensive computational tasks, machine learning projects, and advanced graphics programming.

"This investment represents our commitment to providing students with industry-standard tools and technologies," said Department Head Dr. Carlos Silva. "Students will now have access to the same caliber of equipment used in leading tech companies."

Key additions to our laboratories include:

• High-Performance Computing Cluster: A 16-node cluster for parallel programming and distributed systems courses
• Virtual Reality Development Station: Equipped with Oculus Quest 3 and HTC Vive headsets for VR/AR coursework
• IoT Development Lab: Arduino, Raspberry Pi, and various sensors for Internet of Things projects
• Network Security Lab: Dedicated environment for cybersecurity training and penetration testing

The equipment was acquired through a combination of university funding and partnerships with industry leaders including Intel, NVIDIA, and Microsoft, who provided educational discounts and additional software licenses.

Students will have access to professional development tools including the latest versions of Visual Studio, IntelliJ IDEA, Docker Enterprise, and cloud computing credits for AWS and Google Cloud Platform.

"I'm excited to work with the new VR equipment for my final project," said final-year student João Silva. "Having access to professional-grade tools will definitely help prepare us for the job market."

The new laboratory will be officially inaugurated during the Fall Semester Opening Ceremony on March 15th.
news.author: Dr. Carlos Silva

products.name: Coruja Overflow T-Shirt
products.description: Classic black t-shirt with the iconic Coruja Overflow logo
products.detailedDescription:
Nossa camiseta premium Coruja Overflow é mais do que apenas uma peça de roupa – é uma declaração da sua paixão pela ciência da computação e excelência em programação. Feita de 100% algodão orgânico, esta camisa oferece conforto incomparável, seja você passando uma madrugada depurando código ou apresentando seu projeto mais recente.

O design apresenta nosso icônico logo Coruja Overflow, simbolizando sabedoria e destreza técnica. A impressão de alta qualidade é resistente ao desbotamento e mantém suas cores vibrantes mesmo após várias lavagens.
perfectFor: Uso casual do dia a dia

specifications.name: Cuidados
specifications.value: Lavagem à máquina em água fria

reviewsList.title: Qualidade excepcional!
reviewsList.comment: Comprei esta camiseta para usar durante as aulas e estou impressionado com a qualidade. O tecido é super macio e o logo ficou perfeito. Já recebi vários elogios!

reviewsList.title: Muito confortável
reviewsList.comment: Ótima camiseta para o dia a dia. O tamanho M ficou perfeito em mim. A única coisa é que gostaria que tivesse mais opções de cores.

reviewsList.title: Perfeita para hackathons!
reviewsList.comment: Usei durante o último hackathon da faculdade e foi perfeita. Tecido respira bem e o design representa muito bem nosso curso. Recomendo!

shippingInfo.warranty: Garantia de 6 meses contra defeitos de fabricação
